info.title: ClickUp API V2
info.description:
You can follow along at https://clickup20.docs.apiary.io/#introduction/oauth2.

You'll need your personal token for this, just change the authorization header to include it.

parameters.name: custom_task_ids
parameters.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be true.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Only used when the custom_task_ids parameter is set to true.

post.description: Upload a file to a task as an attachment.

These are the routes for authing the API and going through the OAuth flow.

Applications utilizing a personal API token don't use this endpoint.

Note: OAuth tokens are not supported when using the Try It feature of our Reference docs. You can't try this endpoint from your web browser.

get.description: View the details of the authenticated user's ClickUp account.
View the Workspaces available to the authenticated user.

parameters.name: custom_task_ids
parameters.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be true.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Only used when the custom_task_ids parameter is set to true.

post.description: Add a new checklist to a task.

put.description: Rename a task checklist, or reorder a checklist so it appears above or below other checklists on a task.

delete.description: Delete a checklist from a task.

parameters.name: checklist_id
parameters.description: uuid

post.description: Add a line item to a task checklist.

parameters.name: checklist_id
parameters.description: uuid

put.description:
Update an individual line item in a task checklist.

You can rename it, set the assignee, mark it as resolved, or nest it under another checklist item.

delete.description: Delete a line item from a task checklist.

parameters.name: checklist_id
parameters.description: uuid

parameters.name: checklist_item_id
parameters.description: uuid

parameters.name: custom_task_ids
parameters.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be true.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Only used when the custom_task_ids parameter is set to true.

post.description: Add a new comment to a task.

parameters.name: custom_task_ids
parameters.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be true.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Only used when the custom_task_ids parameter is set to true.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Enter the date of a task comment using Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: start_id
parameters.description: Enter the Comment id of a task comment.

get.description:
View task comments.

If you do not include the start and start_id parameters, this endpoint will return the most recent 25 comments.

Use the start and start id parameters of the oldest comment to retrieve the next 25 comments.

post.description: Add a new comment to a Chat view.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Enter the date of a Chat view comment using Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: start_id
parameters.description: Enter the Comment id of a Chat view comment.

get.description:
View comments from a Chat view.

If you do not include the start and start_id parameters, this endpoint will return the most recent 25 comments.

Use the start and start id parameters of the oldest comment to retrieve the next 25 comments.

post.description: Add a comment to a List.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Enter the date of a List info comment using Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: start_id
parameters.description: Enter the Comment id of a List info comment.

get.description:
View the comments added to a List.

If you do not include the start and start_id parameters, this endpoint will return the most recent 25 comments.

Use the start and start id parameters of the oldest comment to retrieve the next 25 comments.

put.description:
Replace the content of a task commment, assign a comment, and mark a comment as resolved.
Please paste comment_id from original task comment created for continuity

delete.description:
Delete a task comment.
Please paste comment_id from original task comment created for continuity

get.description: View the Custom Fields available on tasks in a specific List.

parameters.name: custom_task_ids
parameters.description: If you want to reference a task by its Custom Task ID, this value must be true.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Only used when the custom_task_ids parameter is set to true.

post.description:
Add data to a Custom field on a task.

You'll need to know the task_id of the task you want to update, and the universal unique identifier (UUID) field_id of the Custom Field you want to set.

You can use Get Accessible Custom Fields or the Get Task endpoint to find the field_id.

parameters.name: custom_task_ids
parameters.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be true.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Only used when the custom_task_ids parameter is set to true.

delete.description: Remove the data from a Custom Field on a task. This does not delete the option from the Custom Field.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: Enter the task ID of the task you want to update.

parameters.name: field_id
parameters.description: Enter the universal unique identifier (UUID) of the Custom Field you want to set.

parameters.name: custom_task_ids
parameters.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be true.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Only used when the custom_task_ids parameter is set to true.

post.description: Set a task as waiting on or blocking another task.

parameters.name: custom_task_ids
parameters.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be true.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Only used when the custom_task_ids parameter is set to true.

delete.description: Remove the dependency relationship between two or more tasks.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: This is the task which is waiting on or blocking another task.

parameters.name: custom_task_ids
parameters.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be true.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Only used when the custom_task_ids parameter is set to true.

post.description: Link two tasks together.

parameters.name: custom_task_ids
parameters.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be true.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Only used when the custom_task_ids parameter is set to true.

delete.description: Remove the link between two tasks.

post.description: Add a new Folder to a Space.

get.description: View the Folders in a Space.

put.description:
Rename a Folder.
Please paste previously created folder_id for continuity

delete.description:
Delete a Folder from your Workspace.
Please paste previously updated folder_id for continuity

get.description: View the Lists within a Folder.

post.description: Add a new Goal to a Workspace.

get.description: View the Goals available in a Workspace.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Team ID (Workspace)

put.description:
Rename a Goal, set the due date, replace the description, add or remove owners, and set the Goal color.
Please paste goal_id from previously created Goal for continuity

delete.description:
Remove a Goal from your Workspace.
Please paste goal_id from previously updated Goal for continuity

get.description:
View the details of a Goal including its Targets.
Please paste goal_id after creating another Goal for continuity.

parameters.name: goal_id
parameters.description: uuid

post.description:
Add a Target to a Goal.
Please use previously created goal_id created before "Get Goal" for continuity

example.name: New Key Result From API V2

parameters.name: goal_id
parameters.description: uuid

put.description:
Update a Target.
Please paste key_result_id from previously created key_result for continuity

delete.description:
Delete a target from a Goal.
Please post key_result_id from the previously edited key_result for continuity. Please also delete the previously created Goal created for testing the "Get Goal" endpoint.

parameters.name: key_result_id
parameters.description: uuid

post.description:
Invite a guest to join a Workspace. To invite a member to your Workspace, use the Invite User to Workspace endpoint.

You'll also need to grant the guest access to specific items using the following endpoints: \ - Add Guest to Folder - Add Guest to List - Add Guest to Task
Note: This endpoint is only available to Workspaces on our Enterprise Plan.

The type of JSON to fill out:
{
  "email": "example@gmail.com",
  "can_edit_tags": true || false,
  "can_see_time_estimated": true || false,
  "can_see_time_spent": true || false
}

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Team ID (Workspace)

put.description:
Rename and configure options for a guest.

Note: This endpoint is only available to Workspaces on our Enterprise Plan.

delete.description:
Revoke a guest's access to a Workspace.

Note: This endpoint is only available to Workspaces on our Enterprise Plan.

get.description:
View information about a guest.

Note: This endpoint is only available to Workspaces on our Enterprise Plan.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Team ID (Workspace)

parameters.name: include_shared
parameters.description: Exclude details of items shared with the guest by setting this parameter to false. By default this parameter is set to true.

Add a task to an additional List.

Note: This endpoint requires the Tasks in Multiple List ClickApp to be enabled.

delete.description:
Remove a task from an additional List. You can't remove a task from its home List.

Note: This endpoint requires the Tasks in Multiple List ClickApp to be enabled.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page to fetch (starts at 0).

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Order by a particular field. By default, tasks are ordered by created.

parameters.name: reverse
parameters.description: Tasks are displayed in reverse order.

parameters.name: subtasks
parameters.description: Include or exclude subtasks. By default, subtasks are excluded.

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description: Filter by statuses. To included closed tasks, use the include_closed parameter.

parameters.name: include_closed
parameters.description: Include or excluse closed tasks. By default, they are excluded.

parameters.name: assignees
parameters.description: Filter by Assignees.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter by tags.

parameters.name: due_date_gt
parameters.description: Filter by due date greater than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: due_date_lt
parameters.description: Filter by due date less than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: date_created_gt
parameters.description: Filter by date created greater than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: date_created_lt
parameters.description: Filter by date created less than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: date_updated_gt
parameters.description: Filter by date updated greater than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: date_updated_lt
parameters.description: Filter by date updated less than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: custom_fields
parameters.description: Include tasks with specific values in one or more Custom Fields.

get.description:
View the tasks in a List.

This endpoint only includes tasks where the specified list_id is their home List. Tasks added to the list_id with a different home List are not included in the response.

put.description:
Update a task.

Paste task_id from previously created task.

Make sure to update all fields when testing to make sure they are all updated.

get.summary: Get time entries within a date range

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Unix time in milliseconds

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Unix time in milliseconds

parameters.name: assignee
parameters.description: Filter by user_id.  Note: Only Workspace Owners/Admins have access to do this.

parameters.name: include_task_tags
parameters.description: Include task tags in the response for time entries associated with tasks.

parameters.name: include_location_names
parameters.description: Include the names of the List, Folder, and Space along with the list_id,folder_id, and space_id.

parameters.name: space_id
parameters.description: Only include time entries associated with tasks in a specific Space.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: Only include time entries associated with tasks in a specific Folder.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: Only include time entries associated with tasks in a specific List.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: Only include time entries associated with a specific task.

parameters.name: custom_task_ids
parameters.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be true.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Only used when the custom_task_ids parameter is set to true.

get.description:
View time entries filtered by start and end date.

By default, this endpoin returns time entries from the last 30 days created by the authenticated user.

To retrieve time entries for other users, you must include the assignee query parameter.

Only one of the following location filters can be included at a time: space_id, folder_id, list_id, or task_id.

Note: A time entry that has a negative duration means that timer is currently running for that user.

parameters.name: custom_task_ids
parameters.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be true.

parameters.description: Only used when the custom_task_ids parameter is set to true.

Note: A time entry that has a negative duration means that timer is currently running for that user.

get.description: View the tasks that appear in a task view in ClickUp.

post.description: Set up a webhook to monitor for events.

get.description:
View the webhooks created via the API for a Workspace.
Please create another webhook and test afterward

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Team ID (Workspace)

delete.description:
Delete a webhook to stop monitoring the events and locations of the webhook.
Please paste webhook_id from previously created webhook for continuity

parameters.name: webhook_id
parameters.description: uuid

requestBody.description:
You may filter the location of resources that get sent to a webhook by passing an optional space_id, folder_id, list_id, or task_id in the body of the request.

If you don't specify any events, all events will be sent to the webhook.

To subscribe to specific events, pass an array of events that you want to subscribe to, or use the wildcard character "*" to subscribe to everything.

put.description: Update a webhook to change the location or events to be monitored.
